intro: Matelea melinii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a sweet fragrance. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a velvety texture. Matelea melinii is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
